items.title: Instagram wants me to make content — I just want to post a photo

items.title: OpenAI acquires AI-powered personal finance app Roi; source: CEO and co-founder Sujith Vishwajith is the only member of Roi's four-person team joining OpenAI (Rebecca Bellan/TechCrunch)
items.summary:
Rebecca Bellan / TechCrunch:
OpenAI acquires AI-powered personal finance app Roi; source: CEO and co-founder Sujith Vishwajith is the only member of Roi's four-person team joining OpenAI  —  OpenAI has acquired Roi, an AI-powered personal finance app.  In keeping with a recent trend in the AI industry, only the CEO is making the jump.

items.title: With its latest acqui-hire, OpenAI is doubling down on personalized consumer AI
items.summary: OpenAI is acquiring the CEO of Roi, an AI financial companion. Roi will sunset its service as its talent heads to OpenAI, ostensibly to help boost revenue in consumer apps.

items.title: Messy workshop or garage? This discounted tool organizer can help, now $50
items.summary:
POKIPO Large Power Tool Organizer

Buy for $50 (Reg. $60)

What we love

I took the time to craft a pegboard wall for all of my tools, but folks that want a heavy-duty solution that can hold “up to 400 pounds” should have a look at this unit. The entire unit spans 36.4 by 11.7 by 8 inches and is ready to be mounted on the wall.

items.title: This recently-released USB-C car charger delivers up to 175W of total power for $27
items.summary:
JOYROOM 175W USB-C Car Charger

Buy for $27 (Reg. $33)

Clip the on-page $6 off coupon.

What we love

This recent release is among some of most powerful car chargers we’ve come across. Offerings we’ve spotted from from Anker, UGREEN, and LISEN tend to top out with output no higher than 170W in total. This one goes a bit further at 175W. This is divvied up between two 100W and 45W Type-C ports in addition to a 30W USB-A.
